mt5Features.feature1_desc1: MT5 supports trading across various asset classes, including forex, stocks, commodities, futures, and cryptocurrencies.
mt5Features.feature1_desc2: Combines all the necessary trading tools in one platform, making it easier for traders to manage different asset classes.
mt5Features.feature2_desc1: Supports the development and use of automated trading strategies through EAs, enabling algorithmic trading.
mt5Features.feature2_desc2: Allows traders to backtest their trading strategies on historical data to optimize performance.
mt5Features.feature3_desc1: Access to the MQL5 community where traders can share strategies, indicators, and EAs, fostering collaboration and knowledge sharing.
mt5Features.feature3_desc2: Comprehensive documentation and user guides are available, making it easier for traders to learn and use the platform effectively.
mt5Features.feature4_desc1: MT5 offers a variety of order types, including market, limit, stop, and trailing stop orders, providing greater flexibility in trade execution.
mt5Features.feature4_desc2: Enhances the speed and convenience of executing trades with a single click directly from the chart.
mt5Features.feature5_desc1: Offers a greater number of timeframes compared to its predecessor (MT4), allowing for more detailed market analysis.
mt5Features.feature5_desc2: Provides a vast array of built-in technical indicators for comprehensive technical analysis.
mt5Features.feature6_desc1: Users can tailor the platform’s layout to suit their trading style, with detachable charts and customizable toolbars.
mt5Features.feature6_desc2: Integrated economic calendar provides real-time updates on economic events, helping traders make informed decisions based on market news.
mt5Features.feature7_desc1: Provides real-time updates on important economic events and indicators, helping traders stay informed about market-moving news.
mt5Features.feature7_desc2: Users can set alerts for upcoming economic events, ensuring they never miss critical market information.
mt5Features.feature8_desc1: MT5 offers extensive charting capabilities with multiple timeframes and a wide range of technical indicators.
mt5Features.feature8_desc2: Provides access to the depth of market (DOM) data, allowing traders to see the buy and sell orders at different price levels.

faq.question_1: How do I qualify for the 20% Deposit Bonus?
faq.answer_1: To qualify for the 20% Deposit Bonus, you must have a PrimeX Standard Plus Account and make a minimum deposit of $500. The bonus can be claimed multiple times, but remember, the total maximum bonus you can receive is capped at $25,000.
faq.question_2: Can I claim the bonus more than once?
faq.answer_2: Yes, you can claim the 20% Deposit Bonus multiple times during the promotion period. However, please note that if any amount is withdrawn from the capital, the entire bonus amount will be retracted.
faq.question_3: How do I claim the bonus as a new client?
faq.answer_3: As a new client, you need to open a Standard Plus Account and make the qualifying deposit of at least $500. Then, complete the form on our webpage. Once your deposit is verified, the bonus will be credited to your account.
faq.question_4: How do I claim the bonus as an existing client?
faq.answer_4: If you are an existing client with a Standard Plus Account, simply deposit a new amount into your account and fill out the form on our webpage. After verification of your deposit, the bonus will be credited to your account.
faq.question_5: When will the bonus be credited to my account?
faq.answer_5: The bonus will be automatically credited to your Standard Plus Account upon verification of the form you submitted on the landing page and confirmation of the deposit amount. You will receive a notification confirming the bonus credit.
faq.question_6: What are the conditions for withdrawing the bonus?
faq.answer_6: To withdraw the bonus, you must fulfill the required trading lot size, which is calculated using the formula: Bonus Amount ÷ 4. For example, if you receive a $100 bonus, you need to trade 25 lots. Please note that stocks and crypto pairs are excluded from this campaign.

withdraw.para_1: Enjoy full access to your bonus.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.question_1: Who can participate in the Trader of the Month competition?
faq.answer_1: Both new and existing PrimeX Capital clients can participate. New clients need to open an account, while existing clients just need to start trading.
faq.question_2: How do I enter the competition?
faq.answer_2: To enter, open a live account with PrimeX Capital, fill and submit the competition form, and start trading.
faq.answer_3: To win, you must be the highest trader within the 30-day competition period.
faq.question_4: Will withdrawing my profits affect my progress in the competition?
faq.answer_4: No, withdrawing your profits will not affect your progress. Your standing in the competition is based solely on your trading performance.
faq.question_5: Can I participate in the competition with my gift account?
faq.answer_5: No, you can participate with standard, narrow and raw accounts.

faq.question_1: Who can participate in the funded account participation?
faq.answer_1: All can participate. It is mandatory for you to have a demo competition account.

faq.answer_2: To enter, open a demo competition account with PrimeX Capital and start trading.
faq.answer_3: To win, you must be in the top 10 with the highest percentage of profits within the 30-day competition period.

faq.answer_4: The maximum drawdown allowed for the competition is 30 percent.

faq.answer_5: You can withdraw your profits, but this will affect your drawdown percentage.

faq.question_1: How do I choose the right account type for me?

Here are the details of each account type:
. Standard Account: Perfect for beginners and novice traders, with a low minimum deposit and competitive spreads.
. Narrow Account: Suitable for traders seeking tighter spreads and more precise trading.

faq.question_1: How do I qualify for the 20% Deposit Bonus?
faq.answer_1: To qualify for the 20% Deposit Bonus, you must have a PrimeX Standard Account and make a minimum deposit of $500. The bonus can be claimed multiple times, but remember, the total maximum bonus you can receive is capped at $25,000.
faq.question_2: Can I claim the bonus more than once?
faq.answer_2: Yes, you can claim the 20% Deposit Bonus multiple times during the promotion period. However, please note that if any amount is withdrawn from the capital, the entire bonus amount will be retracted.
faq.question_3: How do I claim the bonus as a new client?
faq.answer_3: As a new client, you need to open a Standard Account and make the qualifying deposit of at least $500. Then, complete the form on our webpage. Once your deposit is verified, the bonus will be credited to your account.
faq.question_4: How do I claim the bonus as an existing client?
faq.answer_4: If you are an existing client with a Standard Account, simply deposit a new amount into your account and fill out the form on our webpage. After verification of your deposit, the bonus will be credited to your account.
faq.question_5: When will the bonus be credited to my account?
faq.answer_5: The bonus will be automatically credited to your Standard Account upon verification of the form you submitted on the landing page and confirmation of the deposit amount. You will receive a notification confirming the bonus credit.
faq.question_6: What are the conditions for withdrawing the bonus?
faq.answer_6: To withdraw the bonus, you must fulfill the required trading lot size, which is calculated using the formula: Bonus Amount ÷ 4. For example, if you receive a $100 bonus, you need to trade 25 lots. Please note that stocks and crypto pairs are excluded from this campaign.

faq.title: Frequently Asked
faq.question_1: What Does "Pip" Mean in Forex Trading?
faq.answer_1: A pip, short for "price interest point" or "percentage in point," is the smallest price movement possible in the exchange rate of a currency pair according to forex market standards.
faq.question_2: Can Only Professional Traders Participate in Forex Trading?
faq.answer_2: No, forex trading is not limited to professional traders. Anyone can participate, including beginners, who can start with a demo account to practice and gain experience before trading with real money.
faq.question_3: What is a 'Stop Loss' in Forex Trading?
faq.answer_3: A stop loss in forex trading is a tool recommended by brokers to help traders limit potential losses by automatically closing a position at a predetermined price.
faq.question_4: What is Hedging in Forex Trading?
faq.answer_4: Hedging in forex trading involves companies locking in a specific exchange rate for future transactions to mitigate the risk of currency fluctuations when dealing with foreign countries.

whyTrade.description: Forex trading offers diverse opportunities. Whether a day trader, swing trader, or long-term investor, you’ll find ample opportunities to trade currency pairs. Analyze market trends, economic indicators, and geopolitical events to make informed trading decisions.

faq.title: Frequently Asked
faq.answer_1: Investing in precious metals provides diversification, serves as a hedge against inflation and currency devaluation, and offers the potential for significant returns during market volatility.
faq.question_2: How Can I Start Trading Precious Metals?
faq.answer_2: To begin trading precious metals, open a trading account with a broker, research the market, choose your preferred metals, and place your trades based on market analysis.
faq.question_3: What Factors Influence Precious Metal Prices?
faq.answer_3: Prices of precious metals are influenced by factors such as supply and demand, geopolitical events, inflation rates, and changes in currency values.
faq.question_4: What is the Difference Between Physical and Paper Precious Metals?
faq.answer_4: Physical precious metals refer to tangible assets like gold bars and silver coins, whereas paper precious metals involve financial instruments like ETFs and futures contracts that track the value of these metals.
faq.question_5: What is the Role of Precious Metals in Portfolio Diversification?
faq.answer_5: Precious metals can enhance portfolio diversification by providing a non-correlated asset class, reducing overall risk, and potentially improving returns during economic downturns.

whyTrade.description: Metals trading provides a hedge against inflation and opportunities for speculation. Investors can benefit from both short-term price shifts and long-term stability, leveraging metals like gold, silver, and copper to diversify portfolios.

faq.title: Frequently Asked
faq.answer_1: Stocks CFDs allow traders to speculate on the price movements of shares without owning the actual shares. They enable trading in both rising and falling markets and are leveraged products, which can amplify both potential profits and losses.
faq.question_2: What Are Some Effective Stock Trading Strategies for Beginners?
faq.answer_2: Common stock trading strategies for beginners include active trading, day trading, position trading, swing trading, and scalping. It's crucial to identify and time market opportunities and use stop loss orders to minimize losses.
faq.question_3: Where Can I Open a Trading Account to Trade Stock CFDs?
faq.answer_3: To trade CFD stocks online, you can open a trading account with us, research companies and industries, and then open a position based on your analysis.
faq.question_4: Is Trading Share CFDs Different from Buying Shares in a Company?
faq.answer_4: Yes, trading share CFDs differs from buying shares as CFDs are leveraged and don't involve ownership of the stock. When you buy shares, you own a part of the company, while trading CFDs involves speculating on price movements with a smaller initial investment.

whyTrade.description: Stocks trading unlocks opportunities to invest in individual companies. Traders can capitalize on daily market movements or hold shares for long-term growth, benefiting from company performance and broader economic trends.

faq.title: Frequently Asked
faq.question_1: What Does it Mean to Trade an Index?
faq.answer_1: Trading an index involves buying or selling a specific stock market index, which measures the performance of a group of stocks within a particular market.
faq.question_2: Can I Profit from Index Trading?
faq.answer_2: Yes, you can profit from index trading, but there is also the potential for losses, similar to trading other instruments.
faq.question_3: Which Are the Most Popular Stock Indices?
faq.answer_3: Popular stock indices include the S&P 330, Nasdaq, Dow Jones, FTSE 100, Nifty 50, and Nikkei 225
faq.answer_4: Index prices are influenced by the price changes of the index's constituent stocks.
faq.question_5: What is the Best Time to Trade Indices?
faq.answer_5: The best time to trade indices is during the respective market's trading hours. For example, trade the Nasdaq when the US markets are open. Whether to trade stocks or indices depends on an individual's risk appetite and financial goals. There is no universal answer.

whyTrade.description: Trading indices offers exposure to market trends across multiple sectors. Whether targeting short-term gains or long-term growth, indices allow traders to profit from economic cycles and market shifts with reduced individual stock risks.

faq.title: Frequently Asked
faq.question_1: What Does it Mean to Trade Cryptocurrency?
faq.answer_1: Trading cryptocurrency involves buying or selling digital currencies like Bitcoin, Ethereum, or Litecoin on a cryptocurrency exchange. Traders speculate on the price movements of these currencies, either to profit or hedge their positions.
faq.question_2: Can I Profit from Cryptocurrency Trading?
faq.answer_2: Yes, you can profit from cryptocurrency trading, but there is also a potential for significant losses due to the high volatility of the market. It’s essential to have a well-informed trading strategy and risk management plan.
faq.question_3: Which Are the Most Popular Cryptocurrencies to Trade?
faq.answer_3: Popular cryptocurrencies for trading include Bitcoin (BTC), Ethereum (ETH), Ripple (XRP), Litecoin (LTC), and Binance Coin (BNB), among others.
faq.answer_4: Cryptocurrency prices are influenced by a variety of factors, including market sentiment, supply and demand, regulatory news, technological advancements, and broader economic conditions.

whyTrade.description: Crypto trading offers access to a fast-growing market with 24/7 availability. Traders can capitalize on the volatility of digital assets like Bitcoin and Ethereum, seizing both short-term gains and long-term opportunities

faq.title: Frequently Asked
faq.question_1: What Does it Mean to Trade Commodities?
faq.answer_1: Trading commodities involves buying and selling raw materials or primary agricultural products like oil, gold, natural gas, coffee, and wheat. Traders can profit from price movements in these commodities, either by taking physical delivery or speculating on price changes through financial instruments.
faq.question_2: Can I Profit from Commodities Trading?
faq.answer_2: Yes, commodities trading can be profitable, but it also carries risks. Like any other financial market, prices in commodities can fluctuate due to factors like supply and demand, geopolitical events, and market sentiment, leading to potential gains or losses.
faq.question_3: What Are the Most Popular Commodities to Trade?
faq.answer_3: Popular commodities to trade include gold, silver, crude oil, natural gas, wheat, corn, and coffee. Metals, energy, and agricultural products are the three main categories of commodities.
faq.answer_4: Commodity prices are influenced by a variety of factors, including supply and demand, geopolitical tensions, natural disasters, weather conditions, technological advancements, and macroeconomic factors like inflation and currency movements.

whyTrade.description: Commodities trading offers access to markets like oil, gas, and agriculture, responding to global supply and demand. Traders can hedge against inflation and profit from market fluctuations through both short-term trades and strategic investments.

aboutECN.description: PrimeX Capital connects traders directly to global markets. Instead of dealing with a traditional broker, it allows you to execute trades directly with liquidity providers, offering fast executions, low spreads, and complete transparency in all your trades. With PrimeX Capital, you'll get the best available prices in the market with no broker intervention.

acc1.subtitle: Best for Beginners
acc1.description: Easy to Use, No Swap Commission, and Low Spread.

acc2.title: Narrow
acc2.subtitle: Ideal for Scalpers
acc2.description: Low Spread with no Commissions to Boost Profit Opportunities.

acc3.title: Raw
acc3.subtitle: Best for Professionals

whyChooseECN.card1_desc: Displays actual market prices from liquidity providers, offering a clear view of the market.
whyChooseECN.card2_desc: Allows access to a wide range of liquidity providers, increasing the best chances for the best prices.
whyChooseECN.card3_desc: Traders can set buy & sell prices, offering more freedom & a lower spread than traditional systems.
whyChooseECN.card4_desc: Orders are executed directly without the need for brokers or traders.

differentTypesBroker.description: PrimeX Capital offers high transparency and direct execution as an ECN broker, while STP brokers send orders directly between the client and markets, and Market Makers set prices and intervene more in the trading process.
differentTypesBroker.card1_li1: Allows direct access to liquidity providers, increasing the chances of getting the best prices.
differentTypesBroker.card1_li2: No price slippage, allows instant execution at market prices.
differentTypesBroker.card1_li3: Prices and spreads are not set by the broker.
differentTypesBroker.card2_li1: Does not intervene in price setting or impose spreads.
differentTypesBroker.card2_li2: Sends orders to liquidity providers after execution, resulting in price slippage.
differentTypesBroker.card2_li3: May include some execution delays due to intermediary processes.
differentTypesBroker.card3_li1: Sets prices and manages the trading process.
differentTypesBroker.card3_li2: Often has fixed spreads that remain unchanged regardless of market conditions.
differentTypesBroker.card3_li3: Typically does not deal with its own trading positions.
